website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a basic feeder, this one will fit the bill, but it lacks the bells and whistles of others on our list.
pros: Has a straightforward design with a sturdy build thanks to the glass jar and stable bottom
8 ports provides ample room for multiple birds
Easy to take apart, clean, and reassemble
cons: Small jar opening is more difficult to fill than some competitors and may require a funnel to prevent messes

customer_reviews.title: Check Inside the Feeding Ports
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be decent quality feeders. I ordered two. I ordered the 8 oz. That's too small for general use but it's my mistake, not theirs. Go for the 16 oz. The biggest negative I noticed is that the finishing on the inside of the feeder ports on one of the feeders was rough and jagged. I cleaned it up with a nail file and sandpaper. That's a pretty bad fault for a Hummingbird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Gunona

customer_reviews.title: It really is the BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put this one out as a second feeder spacing them about about 30 feet apart since my hummingbirds starting to fight over one feeder. This one is so simple and easy to clean and use but the best thing is that my hummingbirds seem to prefer it over my other one that is a bit fancier. It was tricky at first to figure out that the top red plastic feeder part does not really attach to the bottom base. Once you twist the bottle into the base after filling, everything is secure. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol P.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and hummingbird useable
customer_reviews.text: There were several negative reviews so I was a little hesitant to order. However, I'm so glad I did. The hummingbirds were using it by day 2. It looks pretty and is quite sturdy. Easy to clean, and since the Kaytee 100506148 Electro Nectar needs to be changed out every 3 days, I was glad it was so simple to do. To deter the pesky ants, I sprayed WD40 on a paper towel and rubbed onto the pole from ground up about 2 feet. That left 2 feet or more clean below the feeder so no mishaps would occur with the birds. All in all, I heartily recommend this. I've packed it away now and will use again next summer.
customer_reviews.author: trisdon

customer_reviews.title: Best Feeder on The Market
customer_reviews.text: Best hummingbird feeder on the market. I have tried several brands and This is the only one I will use to feed these amazing birds. Keeping the feeder clean is essential to keeping the birds healthy. If mold or bacteria gets into the feeder, it can make the birds sick. It is easy to clean and assemble. The craftsmanship of the feeders is excellent. I have 6 of these feeders total. 4 of them are over 7 years old. I can not emphasize enough to anyone feeding these birds through a feeder as to how important it is to keep feeders clean and well maintained. It is essential to the health of these birds.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is breaking down and smells like VOCs
customer_reviews.text: My feeder is two years old. In the past month I have started smelling plastics, like VOCs, on the red parts that form the feeder itself. This can't be good for the birds, and if the plastic is breaking down it must be getting into the nectar. Have you changed the plastic you use for these feeders? If so I would like a replacement. If not I'm afraid I'm going to have to throw this one out. It's like feeding the birds in a hazardous waste dump.
customer_reviews.author: Liz in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Could be the best...
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to give this rig five stars: the hummingbirds absolutely love it, and it is very substantially made. I have four other feeders, and the hummers show a distinct preference for this feeder. The problem is that there were sharp casting flashings around the feed holes, sharp enough to harm the birds' fragile beaks, I would think. I reamed the feeders out with a drill bit. It was quite easy to do, but I suspect not everyone would attend to the problem (nor should they have to), which might put the birds at risk. Aside from this, it is the best, but this is too great a defect to overlook.
customer_reviews.author: RW Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Great hummingbird feerer with some modifications! My birds love the feeder and it is so easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This hummingbird feeder is a favorite of my birds! Base comes apart for easy and thorough cleaning! I used a sharp knife to make the feeding ports larger after reading that some hummingbirds have been found stuck in the small feeding port holes! YIKES! One complaint is the hangar is not siliconed well to the bottle, only a spot of silicone in 2 places. Once the silicone pulls off the bottle the entire feeder comes crashing to the ground or cement in my case. It broke! We put extra silicone on the rest of these feeders to prevent future breakage. This is still one of my favorite feeders!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Best hummer feeder I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have used these hummer feeders for years and have about 5 of them. I get the small size because the large one isn't emptied in time to keep the nectar from starting to get cloudy, which is dangerous for the birds. More work, but better for the birds. I've have many feeders over the years but once I found these I've never bought any other type. The plastic rings the birds perch on is very fragile however so you have to take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Hummers happy!
customer_reviews.text: Great design, very sturdy, glass bottle. This is the only feeder I'll use, and the hummingbirds visit all day every day! Bees don't hang around at all, we do get some black carpenter ants the somehow end up in the bottle. To stop that from happening, I use cocoa butter that has been melted with a bit of wax in a double boiler then poured into a muffin pan. Once the cocoa butter is starting to reform, add a few drops of cinnamon oil, cajeput, or other 'hot' essential oil. Once the bar is fully cooled, rub a small amount on your hands then run your hands over the the string only, avoid getting any on the feeding area.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The product is in three pieces, fairly easy to clean and sturdily made. You need a good set of different-sized cleaning brushes. I like that you can set it down upside down after filling and assembling, then turn it over and move the bail into position to hang. It doesn’t leak, like my last feeder. The ant moat, however, is ridiculous. I filled it one evening only to have it empty enough for the ants to cross by late the next morning. It’s both narrow and shallow. If you have an issue with ants where you hang your feeder, you need to buy or make a separate ant moat.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA R

customer_reviews.title: Back to My Old Standby
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these feeders for years (12-15), and the plastic finally got old and brittle, so that when I dropped it, it broke. I tried several replacements, including some that did not gravity feed, but either the material they were made from corroded, or they were hard to clean, or messy to fill and maintain. I finally started searching and was thrilled to see this on Amazon. I'm back in business, and my hummers are happy! Good all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: SueZQ

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best hummingbird feeders I've used. And I can say the little birds love them. There's a ring base around the feed that allows for the birds to sit while feeding, they sometimes stay for a couple minutes. The negative is they claim to prevent insects from getting in and that is true; however they still attract wasps, bees or anything that like sugar/sweet nectar. Cleaning them is a chore as well, all the little feeding holes get mold in them and unless you have pipe cleaners you'll have a tuff time geting it all out. I do recommend them, they are well made, should last a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Bigten418

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder but...
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder but have a complaint. The metal that holds the glass jar on a hook, is very flimsy. It'd be a full 5 stars IF they could improve that and replace for current customers an improved jar/handle. It's the EASIEST feeder I've found yet to clean. Most of my feeder unfortunately I have to replace every season or so due to leaking. There are no plastic rim covers to get chewed up by mold. I'm hoping for the best with this and maybe my husband can create a better way to wrap the jar and hang it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Hills

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!  This is TINY!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand feeder. I've used the 32 ounce size for several years. It was my mistake to buy this particular one, but I still rated it down because at 8 oz it is not really practical if you have a lot of hummingbirds. It might work now while the birds are sparse, but later in the summer 8 oz won't last a day of feeding. As to my error, I was unaware that they were making a smaller one these days and so I saw the picture and clicked to buy. I will not buy this size again.
customer_reviews.author: NDuke

customer_reviews.title: Hummers loved it, so did the ants..
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I wanted this one to work because the hummingbirds actually preferred it over my fancier one. But I fortunately the ants loved this feeder too, and the tiny ridge for an "ant well" evaporates in a few hours time or is so small the ants can cross it? Anyway after a few weeks my hummers won't use it anymore since it always seems to be crawling with them and not my other. Gonna toss it and find again with something with a bigger ant well.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: A delightful surprise.  Loved by our hummers over other feefers.
customer_reviews.text: Boy were we surprised. Of three feeders er have, the little guys really love this one - draining it daily. Very easy to assemble and clean. Deceptively simple, yet effective. We're going to but another because they ignore the other feeders. UPDATE JUNE 19TH: Received our second order. After filling and as hanging, I was buzzed by our hummer. He immediately tested the new installation and gladly found it to his liking.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D

customer_reviews.title: The name says it all: Best-1!
customer_reviews.text: My dad is an avid hummingbird watcher and recommended this feeder. They love it - they can perch on it and rest while eating, so they stay for long enough to really enjoy seeing them. The openings make is so hornets and wasps can't get to the liquid. It's definitely utilitarian / minimalist in design, but what's attractive to the human eye isn't what is attractive to the birds, and the birds are the reason for the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Regina M. Napolitano

customer_reviews.title: The hummingbirds love it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a few different types of hummingbird feeders to test out, and this one is by far the favorite of our hummingbirds. It doesn't look like much, but it definitely gets the most attention in our yard. The birds visit frequently and perch on the edge to eat. I came back to order another one! I purchased the 8 oz size, which is small, but perfect for changing frequently so the food doesn't get stale. I definitely recommend this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Let the Bad Ratings Scare You
customer_reviews.text: With all of the negative posts, I was a bit leery of trying this feeder. I still can’t figure out what the naysayers wanted or expected. It doesn’t leak. It’s easy to clean. It doesn’t attract insects like others we have tried. Most importantly, the Hummers love it. I put this thing out and I backed away about two feet and we had our first visitor. All the talk about the bad angles of the feeding holes is nonsense. The small size of the container is nice. It doesn’t give the nectar a chance to go bad.
customer_reviews.author: R. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Missing from order
customer_reviews.text: The feeder did not come with my order. I got a small bag of hummingbird nectar, but nothing to put it in. I have tried to contact Amazon, but there is no customer service to be found! I really want this, but I have no idea how. I’ll give this 1 star, since I really like the way it looks. Maybe, if I ever actually get it, my review will be better. I’m hoping someone from Amazon will read this, and be able to tell me how to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is not the most attractive (to a human) but it sure fits the bill for being the most practical. It is more stable in high winds without spillage than any I have tried and is really easy to clean. It doesn't hold a lot, but if you don't have enough hummers to empty it in 3 days, then it is really the right size as the nectar easily rots/molds. Keep your nectar in the 'fridge and change it more often than not.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This little hummer feeder holds just enough instead of so much the feeder gets moldy before being empty. It is easy to clean being glass and using a curved hummer feeder brush. The plastic dish portion is also easy to disassemble, clean, and assemble. If the plastic portions get brittle, replacements are available. The holes were just the right size, not blocked at all.
customer_reviews.author: Boggart

customer_reviews.title: Yes it does work, it just takes a couple of days for the wasps to get the hint and buzz off.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wasp proof hummingbird feeder. This one did the trick...just not instantly. UPDATE: after getting rid of the wasps, I got ants. Lots of them. The solution is hanging the feeder with monofilament thread (fishing line) and only fill the base up a 1/4 inch. I'm now ant free. Unfortunately I didn't know hummingbirds were territorial jerks. It's a good thing he/she is so darn cute.
customer_reviews.author: Maru

customer_reviews.title: Works great and no bees.
customer_reviews.text: Our standard hummingbird feeder began attracting bees, making it hard for the hummingbirds to feed. Bees are great but they need to be pollinating flowers, not hanging around my hummingbird feeder. The hummingbirds began using our new feeder right away without any problem. The bees kept checking it out but apparently can't reach the sugar water. After a few days the bees gave up. Love the new feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Feeders that really work
customer_reviews.text: PROs: A very good, simple hummingbird feeder. Bee-proof. Easy to clean, fill and deploy. Durable. CONs: Not the most attractive (to humans) feeder out there. Not ant-proof (needs a barrier, if that's a problem). Plastic is not heat-resistant or dishwasher-safe and bottle is glass, which together makes for a slightly fragile product. Maker says that new models use UV-resistant plastic, but haven't had mine long enough to evaluate that. Buy again? These are the third and fourth ones I've had, so, yes.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Glass container screws in at a slight angle
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd feeder I had to send back for the same reason. The bottle screws into the bottom at a slight angle. I have nectar leaking out of one hole and the hole opposite is dry. Will try a different feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, these are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These ARE the best hummingbird feeders! I’ve tried others, some decorative, some artsy, some plain, but I have settled on Best 1 feeders. They hold up well exposed to the summer weather. They do not leak. They are easy to hang, easy to clean, and handy to store during the off season. I won’t buy any other kind of feeder for our visiting hummingbirds.
customer_reviews.author: elliem

customer_reviews.title: These are the best hummingbird feeders!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these feeders for years and will continue to do so. I had a problem with Gila woodpeckers draining the feeders. I broke the perch feature off and my hummers now get their food. I love the fact that I can clean the feeders in the dishwasher; plastic on the top and glass on the bottom. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size!
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the feeder I was afraid it was too small as there is a larger size. It took 4 weeks for my two humming birds to find and use it. I have to put new feed in every 4 days as the heat ruins the mix. This size is perfect my two small friends! If you have a swarm of humming birds, buy the larger size!
customer_reviews.author: Misstcat

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, there was no glass breakage
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item in May 2015. The top portion with the hook failed miserably. Within 2 months, the top slid right off the bottle and the entire thing fell to the ground. Fortunately, there was no glass breakage. The top is a terrible design, the round pice that slides over the bottle has no strength, it was held together with what looked like glue dots, that did not hold up in the 100 degree plus weather. The entire top hanger piece should be redesigned to ues some type of sling, even a macrame sling would be better than how it's made. Title says it's "Best". This feeder is not best. Once the design it could be a great feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Chew

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a glass top and plastic bottom with a ledge to stand on that’s not super expensive, and this is exactly that! The metal base I had rusted and I didn’t want to risk getting them sick. Holds the perfect amount for about 2 weeks of feeding the amount of hummingbirds we have. It’s seen a ton of action so I’m happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. K

customer_reviews.title: The hummers love not having to fight off wasps to use this feeder
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is the best hummingbird feeder on the market. I especially like that it holds just 8 ounces so you are pretty much forced to keep it clean which is super easy to do. I have four of these feeders so I could always keep two out while I am cleaning the other two. I suggest you use an ant moat if you have problems with these creatures invading your hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.author: D. Karlsen

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Dont let the size of this gem fool you. It's made very well with a solid glass dome and plastic feeder that easily comes apart to clean. And unlike many hummingbird feeders you can stand it up on it's own while filling. The hummers can actually sit and rest and drink to their little hearts content at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Birdfeeder
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase a smaller bird feeder so I could keep the liquid fresher. I also wanted one with a base that would not allow all the bigger birds to take over. This one fits the bill! (No pun intended, lol!) I do not fill the bottle all the way and turn it over in my sink so that I do not have any spilling when I hang it outside. It is very sturdy and so easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Rayah

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is okay but definitely NOT the "best". The bottle is difficult to clean. I change my nectar every 2 days but it forms mold inside the bottle and the opening is so small I can't get a bottle brush in it. The feeder is fairly sturdy but cannot be put in the dishwasher. It's better to spend a bit more and buy a polycarbonate feeder that is dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBun

customer_reviews.title: Not bee proof
customer_reviews.text: While this feeder is better than the typical feeder, it is definitely NOT bee proof. At last cleaning I had 4 bees inside...one which was still alive. I've also had wasps that drink from the area where the bottle attaches to the red plastic. Better than most, but the bees still come.
customer_reviews.author: skdonner

customer_reviews.title: Glass hummingbird feeder is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The glass bottle was excellent for hummingbird applications. And the 8 oz size is just the right size. When smaller there is too much cleaning and when larger there is waste of the unused mixture. My one suggestion would be to make the bird standing a little stronger. I have had two previous feeders of this type and the support rods tend to break at washing or large birds hopping on and taking a drink of a sweet mixture. This weakness does not stop my saying that this is a favorite of the many types of hummingbird feeders that I have tried in the past.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: My preferred hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these feeders for years. Hummingbirds seem to prefer them. I like that they hang straight, some saucer style feeders do not. They are easy to clean. Because hummingbirds are territorial I use several of them spaced out in the yard. All feeders should be cleaned and refilled every 3-4 days therefore I never fill them more than half way up. I would rather the birds empty them in 2 days than to let them sit and develop algae. I make 4 cups of sugar water at a time. Fill the bottles half way then store the left over water in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: robert Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best little hummingbird feeder, ever. Built in perch, 8 feeding holes, glass reservoir, easy to clean, sturdy and durable. There are fancier feeders on the market, but pretty frills don't impress the hummingbirds. If you want a durable, easy to fill and maintain feeder that will last for years...this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: I've been given many "pretty" hummingbird feeders over the years, but for ease of use and performance for the birds, this one is the best. Every thing about it is thoughtfully designed. It's easy to clean and long-lasting. The birds may rest while feeding. One tip: I don't fill the feeders any more than will fill the red dish. The quickest way for the liquid to spoil is for the sun to reach the portion exposed in the glass bottle. I fill more frequently, so the birds drink the liquid before it has a chance to spoil. This is a great system.
customer_reviews.author: Canine Celebrity

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Wasps can't get into this, and if it's really windy, it doesn't spill the feeding solution all over. The hummingbirds can sit while they feed, which I think must be nicer for them. Sometimes they just sit on it and rest. I like that it does not have yellow flowers because that just attracts wasps to it. I have had problems with spilling, with wasps chasing the hummingbirds away, etc. on every other feeder. It is also very easy to clean and to fill. Great product !
customer_reviews.author: RHG

customer_reviews.title: I love the size of these feeders
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of these feeders, and the quality is great. This is the 3rd type of feeder I've purchased since Spring and I was hopeful that the bumblebees could not get anything out of this. Unfortunately, my hopes are dashed as they are gobbling up the contents. They are relentless. I have not spilled any on the outside, even wiped and dried it after hung to be sure. I've a few hummers who show up still, just hop from spot to spot when the bees try to move them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Does not leak.
customer_reviews.text: Have several of those feeders for a couple of years now, even the larger version. Love how easy to clean they are and they DO NOT leak! Wished the company would make the glass a little prettier and more colorful. Do not like the writing on the larger feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Nimmersatt

customer_reviews.title: Hummers love this feeder
customer_reviews.text: I was originally concerned that it wasn't colorful enough, but from the day we put it up, the humming birds have been flocking around it. It is our only feeder with a perch for them. Didn't know they prefer perches when feeding, since flowers don't have perches.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best hummingbird feeder I have used
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best hummingbird feeder I have used! All summer long the birds were actually fighting over it. Sometimes 3 or 4 of them dive bombing each other to keep it to themselves. It is easy to clean, I had no problems with ants (had an ant trap above it) and attracted tons of hummingbirds. Sadly they seem to have left either yesterday or today, but come spring I will have this out and waiting for their return. I did not use commercially prepared nectar. I make my own sugar water. 1 cup of boiling water to dissolve 1/4 cup sugar. When cooled I filled the freshly washed feeder with this mixture.
customer_reviews.author: A. Edgeworth

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I did not look at the size before I bought it and it is a mini version of one we already had which turns out is just fine since we don't fill them up all the way anyway so that they can get fresh stuff each day without wasting a lot of the sugar water.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Best Hummingbird Feeder - Hands Down!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased lots of different hummingbird feeders over the past 10 years and this feeder is by far is the best one that I've ever had! It doesn't leak nor does it attract wasps, something that all other feeds tend to do. Loved my first one so much that I ended up buying a second feeder to attract more hummers! Love this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Out In MT

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three uses
customer_reviews.text: The third time I took this feeder down to clean it the metal ring slid off the glass bottle, crashing onto the ground. The glass didn't break but the red plastic base broke apart where the bottle screws into the base (see picture). . To have me rate this as excellent, I would appreciate being sent a replacement base so I can use the feeder. I understand that my timeline to return this product has elapsed. Thank you for any help you can give me with this matter.
customer_reviews.author: meggie

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to easily clean the feeder. Using a little Chlorox with the cleaner reduces the mold buildup considerably. Of course be sure to really rinse the feeder well after cleaning. I use two feeders to allow one to thoroughly dry before reusing. I've used many different feeders and was never satisfied until this one and the hummers like the perch to sit and sip.
customer_reviews.author: KC Swede

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Our hummingbirds seemed quite perplexed by this for a few days. First I put a silk flower on the chain to attract them, but they kept trying to eat out of the flower. Then I stuck a flower in one of the holes and that got them to land. Finally they figured out how to drink from it. I like this in that they actually land to drink so you can get a better look at them. It's easy to clean and doesn't leak. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Frank Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing so far.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice that this only holds 8 oz, which is just too little. After filling it when I flipped it over to hang up about a third of the nectar sloshed out of the holes. So far no hummers have shown up to use it. Someone told me this can go through the dishwasher but the instructions clearly say not to.
customer_reviews.author: DIssatisfied

customer_reviews.title: A perfect small feeder
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present for someone who needed a feeder to go on a slender stand that would not support a full-size one. It is ideal: the 8 oz. capacity lasts long enough not to need constant refilling, and the base is of sufficient diameter to give the hummers proper perching room (it's the same base used in their full-size feeders). Hummers started using it almost at once, just like they did the 3 full-size ones at my house.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this hummingbird feeder several times as it works and is easy to clean. No assembly required either Hummingbirds love it. I would suggest any hummingbird enthusiast to purchase this and then just sit back and enjoy all the fun!
customer_reviews.author: Mare1949

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed and attractive to birds
customer_reviews.text: This summer, I tried three different types of humming bird feeders. The Best feeder proved to truly be the best! The humming birds preferred this feeder over the other designs. Plus, this feeder was much easier to clean, refill, and attach back up in the tree where our humming birds come to visit. I liked this feeder so well that I purchased a second feeder and took down one of the other feeders that the birds rarely used. The Best feeder is sturdy, has never leaked, and is easy to maintain. I just might buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: BEST Hummingbird Feeders Ever
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these smaller hummingbird feeders as it was time to replace larger ones of the same brand. These feeders are the best. They last a very long time and while they seem to be a simple design the Hummingbirds love them and the food by the same company. The smaller feeders are perfect for my patio area. If you have a large backyard with a lot of hummingbirds coming and going, these will be to small as you will be refilling them daily. These smaller feeders hold about 1 1/2 C. of food.
customer_reviews.author: TBee

customer_reviews.title: It has earned it's name "Best-1"
customer_reviews.text: Disregard the video. I bought this feeder to replace the new Perky Pet hummingbird feeder with a wide mouth glass reservoir, which would leak when the sun hit it, the air above the fluid would expand (because of the sun warming the air above the nectar). I hung this one out and shortly after the first hummingbird appeared sat upon the perch and drank heartily. I've had many visitor in the first hour, more than the previous.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.  Daily

customer_reviews.title: Yay...glass container!
customer_reviews.text: Very, very difficult to find glass containers which hold approximately 8 oz. of liquid. So glad we found this! Used for the first time last month. We have seen hummers drinking! Easy to clean and to fill. The item was packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY AND DURABILITY HAVE DECLINED SIGNIFICENTLY!
customer_reviews.text: I DONT LIKE THAT THE GLASS BOTTLES NOW BREAK FAIRLY EASILY AND THAT THE FEEDER HOLE ARE OFTER MISSHAPEN, BECAUSE OF BEE'S IT IS NECESSARY TO PUT SMALL CLEAR RUBBER TIPS INSIDE ON THE HOLE SO THAT BEES CAN NOT ACCESS THE NECTURE. HOWEVER WHEN THE HOLES ARE MISSHAPEN OR SMALL TAGS OF PLASTIC ARE LEFT ON THE INSIDE THE BEE GUARDS DO NOT FIT ON THE INSIDE. THIS PRODUCT IS TOO COSTLY TO HAVE THES KINDS OF PROBLEMS. 20 YEARS AGO THEY WERE MUCH BETTER!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hanger Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of this feeder. A sturdy plastic bottom that is easy to clean and a glass bottle. But it's not any good if the hanger glue only holds for a month. When I unpacked the feeder, I mentally questioned the one-glue-glob holding the metal hanger to the bottle. Thankfully the bottle did not break. As soon as the parts are dry, I am going to glue the hanger around the bottle perimeter and rehang in 2 days. Hard to believe that there are not more complaints about the design. Took 2 stars away because of this flaw and my inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: PatinSC

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this feeder. I had another feeder that the bees were attracted to as well as the humming birds. This one is awesome! The bees can't get to the sugar water and the birds love to just sit on the ledge of the feeder. Will definitely buy again. Makes a great gift also. The "bottle" is made of glass.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne DiMirra

customer_reviews.title: Our hummingbirds Love this.
customer_reviews.text: My previous feeders held a lot more and had yellow plastic flowers around the opening - things I thought I needed. This has no flowers and the hummingbirds were on it 15 minutes after I put it out. I also found that I waste less sugar water and that the shorter bottle is easier to clean. I will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Carter S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Modest looks, but Birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Birds abandoned my fancy feeder right away. They clearly favor the wide platform they can sit down on and have a meal like a person over my aesthetically pleasing perky pet jar they can't land upon. Who am I to tell a bird how to eat? They burn insane amount of energy for flight as is, so the new modest feeder allows them for energy net gain. Also, large all red platform makes it easy for them to spot their buffet. Sometimes, less is more, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: azazellie

customer_reviews.title: Yellow Jackets &Hornets
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these because of the great reviews I read on them for keeping Yellow Jackets and Hornets off of them. Boy, was that a lie.I have both of them all over these feeders, and now I have no hummingbirds at all.Waste of money because they are useless !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with nectar holes
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Very disappointed to see the nectar holes were rough and many were gunked up and partially closed off by plastic drip/overspray (during the manufacturing process?). Straight out of the box it will need to have the holes redrilled before it is safe and useable for the hummers. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Best-1 Hummingbird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Living in a desert environment, a hummingbird feeder needs to be able to hold up to the heat. Just replaced the Best-1 Hummingbird Feeder after several years of use. The design makes it easy for the hummingbirds to perch and eat and attracts many. It is also easy to clean. After having used a number of different types of hummingbird feeders in the past, the Best-1 Hummingbird Feeder surpasses them all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly the best
customer_reviews.text: My hummingbirds love this feeder. It's easy to clean and easy to hang. Perfect in every way. For homemade nectar, I just use 4 cups of hot water to 1 cup of sugar. No need to buy store bought stuff, and NEVER put in any food coloring.
customer_reviews.author: CBug70

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace existing feeder whose replacement parts no longer deter yellow jackets. Birds love it and have not seen any yellow jackets. Been up since spring. You can clean with bottle brush and base comes apart for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great little feeder but needs to have band attached more securely
customer_reviews.text: I actually love these feeders. They are the perfect size. I have been using them for many years. However, this year two of the glass bottles slipped lose from the metal holder (glued) and crashed to the ground. Surprisingly they didn't break, but I had a heck of a mess to clean up before the ants and yellow jackets found the nectar. I think repeated hand washing with warm water may have melted the glue?? Manufacturer needs to make sure the band stays put.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Lark

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeder!!
customer_reviews.text: The feature I like best about this feeder is that it is glass with a metal hanger and is just the right size. I don't have a lot of hummingbirds, so this fits the bill. The plastic for the bottom is strong and it is easy to fill and clean. So for me, It is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Tarantolo

customer_reviews.title: Works okay but hangs crooked
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive feeder. The hummingbirds took to it right away. However it wouldn’t hang straight no matter what I tried. The issue seems to be threading on the top part of the red base. The bottle sits perfectly straight when screwed into the base without the top (part with the feeding holes). I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Singski

customer_reviews.title: Great design.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model of hummingbird feeder for a third time for __ reasons. Easy to clean, lasts in the sun for years, hummingbirds get to perch and above all, doesn’t attract the loads of wasps & bees like other models. To avoid ants, I also hang them below a type of moat. But the fact that it doesn’t leak helps avoid ants too. Only thing, I probably should have purchased a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: A G N

customer_reviews.title: Simply perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the simplicity and streamlined aesthetics of this feeder as well as the smaller nectar capacity to insure freshness and less waste. No annoying little plastic flowers to clean, but the hummingbirds love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great..
customer_reviews.text: I tested many Hummingbird feeders out and this has been the best. Low maintenance. Glass bottle automatically keeps the base filled. No leaks whatsoever. Dont make the mistake I made and trim the reinforcement off the bottom of the holes - the bees got in. So I ordered another base and no more bees. Fresh nectar is very easy to make: boil a cup a water, add sugar, let cool. Done. *But* - the sugar water needs to be changed every week/ week and a half, because mold forms pretty quickly and the birds wont drink moldy nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Rootkick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love this product so far! Hummingbirds love it too! We’ve had several very windy storms and it’s been ok. I was worried it might blow off onto the ground but it’s stayed pretty solid on it’s hook.
customer_reviews.author: junebug

customer_reviews.title: Tried all, this is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hummingbird feeder available. It is simple, not ridiculously ornate, sturdy, fairly easy to clean and durable. Birds can also perch on the feeder which many do, even hummers. There are several features that I like best that are not really advertised. Should the bottle break, it can be replaced with any standard-sized plastic or glass bottle. Best of all, by removing the top with its hummingbird holes, it becomes an oriole feeder.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Cornett

customer_reviews.title: No Critters
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding hummingbird feeder. It is well designed and constructed for hummers AND to keep bugs out of the feeder. I bought the first....and after a short time I purchased the second one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T724

customer_reviews.title: This is the 'best' hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hummingbird brand and style for decades. I like that is has a glass bottle and the plastic base is very durable. It's very easy to clean and lasts for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Theodore

customer_reviews.title: Mine leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Filled this twice and it was great - I fill in the evening. Then after that every time I'd check, it was empty. Suspected a leak, so I hung it off my kitchen faucet with papers underneath, checked after about 15 minutes, and there's a drip. It's a slow drip, but after several hours, it empties out. Was happy this one for ease of cleaning, but now I definitely need to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rommel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding hummingbirds for years. I have a much larger version of this exact bird feeder which I've had for years and the hummingbirds seem to love this design. I purchased this thinking it was bigger but it actually is perfect. It's not fancy. It's very utilitarian. It works perfectly. It's very easy to clean. It took the hummingbirds an afternoon to discover it. It arrived very quickly. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a new one just like my old one and found it. Same brand and works great. Will use next year as the birds have gone south now. A bit pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ABootthang

customer_reviews.title: they don't leak
customer_reviews.text: I like these feeders and have used them for years. They don't leak sugared water to attract ants but it is still a good idea to use an ant trap because the ants will find them eventually. They are easy to clean with a plain toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: so far it's great
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough for the purpose and the design is a lot less slosh-y than others I've had, making it easier to put up after filling. Hummingbirds sit on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: jim hughes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It is very important to keep hummingbird feeders clean. They should be cleaned every 3 days in hop weather. Mould easily forms in the sugar water and can sicken or kill the birds. This is the only feeder I have found that is easy to get thoroughly clean. I have used these feeders for years and highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Kat64

customer_reviews.title: Not Bee Proof
customer_reviews.text: So I have been having problems with bees at my feeders, I bought this one because in some reviews it says bee proof, no it's not! They can still get into ports and do, no way to add guards on it either. So if your looking for one thats truly is bee proof look at other ones. Because it's not true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and let me tell you the metal part on the top came off and the plastic where you screw the bottle into the base broke. This did not last long not worth the money please don't buy one with a metal holder because they break and having one built into the bottle would work better.....
customer_reviews.author: stylus

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing this year...maybe it's a big bee year...or hornets.  Hummers have to avoid hornets to get to feeding holes.
customer_reviews.text: No bees or a few ants in one of three feeders. Excellent as we read that yellow flowers on a red feeder deter hummingbirds. All those fancy bells and whistles are to attract people, not hummingbirds! Having bought other ones with lots of decoration, now on a basement shelf. NOT AS GOOD RESULTS THIS YEAR (2015) AS Hummers have to compete with bees, hornets for access. We have tried to splash water on feeder to get rid of bees. May be the bee/hornet population this year that is so aggressive. Have killed two nests but not sure why none in previous years and several this year
customer_reviews.author: Andy Port

customer_reviews.title: Really is the best hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I've had several different feeders and none have been as great as this one. It's so easy to clean. It does a great job of keeping out ants. The hummingbirds LOVE it. They found it very quickly. I had to get 2 because we attracted so many hummingbirds.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small hummingbird feeder, but it's nice b/c it makes me remember to clean and refill the feeder on a more regular basis. Easy to put together and hang.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: It's true, Best is a better Hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Wow, This feeder is a substantial step up from the average junk being sold as hummingbird feeders . I will only purchase Best feeders after seeing the quality of this design and product. Thanks to the folks at Best for a good solid product.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Evidently this feeder is a favorite with the hummingbirds around our property! We've never seen as many with the feeders we used previously. Love the way this one is so easy to clean - there isn't any nectar left to spoil and turn nasty. I plan to order another one, but the price has gone up quite a bit in two weeks' time, so I'll wait until the price (hopefully) comes back down. The feeding holes are small enough that flies and bees aren't able to get in, and I ordered an ant moat to use with the feeder, so that has helped a lot. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Steamboat

customer_reviews.title: The BEST feeder EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hummingbird feeder. I had one and a windstorm blew it down and it broke. I purchased another one here on Amazon, and it was exactly the same. The hummingbirds love it because they can perch. I have it under a big red plastic umbrella thing and here in WA the hummingbirds appreciate the break from the rain. It is really easy to clean and refill. It's not the cheapest one out there, but worth it. I wouldn't have any other kind any more.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia S, MS

customer_reviews.title: A Well-designed Feeder.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and easy to take completely apart for cleaning. The smaller size is great since we don't get a great many hummingbirds at any one time. The hummingbirds do seem to prefer the old-style drip feeders, but the bees were so thick on them that they drove both the hummingbirds (and me) away from them. And I do appreciate the fact that it's made in the USA! I saw some reviews where the metal holding ring came off, so before I used my feeder, I put some dabs of epoxy on the ring and I've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth between a 4 and a 5 star for this. My biggest goal in purchasing a new feeder was to get something the frikkin' yellow jackets couldn't access. This feeder does that beautifully. Our last $1-a-piece stinging insect feeders were worth exactly what we paid for them. My only disappointment was that the holes on this didn't have any flowers/shapes around them. While the hummies did figure it out fast enough, a raised flower would have assured water could only enter through the tiny hole when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan T

customer_reviews.title: Our hummingbirds love this feeder...
customer_reviews.text: I like this feeder because the hummingbirds have a place to rest if they want to, it is easy to clean & they love it! Also I have only noticed a bee near the feeder once & the one we had before did have a bee problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Crane

customer_reviews.title: One of the best feeders over all
customer_reviews.text: After trying lots of different feeders this remains my favorite. The bottle is made of glass; most other options are plastic. They are all hard to clean so I am not dinging this one for that, but it is a pain to have to scrub all the interior and orifices of the bottom section. That comes in 2 parts making it slightly easier to clean than some others do not. The plastic parts will break down over time. It has a good design for the wire - enough space to be able to hang it easily without adding adding wire or such.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: It does the job by stopping the bees from eating from the feeder. However, it doesn't keep the ants from going in the holes and ending up in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Tray Tray

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Hung the feeder and had hummingbirds the next day, so exciting! Yellow jackets fly away. I keep the dribbles clean so not to attract, like the instructions state. No problems. Haven't cleaned it yet. Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful how you clean it
customer_reviews.text: If the feeder isn't thoroughly cleaned every few days, it will accumulate mold on the plastic parts, which are not easy to clean. I put mine in boiling water to clean it, and he heat warped both plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but the best!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried every type of hummingbird feeder and this very simple one, is definitely the best! The birds like it, it’s easy to clean and it’s sturdy. I’ve thrown out all the other ones and ordered more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: my hummingbirds would not use it! no matter what i did you make it attractive.
customer_reviews.text: i don't know why, but my hummingbirds repeatedly rejected this bird feeder, preferring the cheaper plastic version. i would note that the holes on this one were much smaller than on the other. i even enlarged them hoping that would entice them, but noooooooo...other than that, i don't know what the problem might be. all this feeder attracted were yellow jackets and wasps.
customer_reviews.author: B Howell

product_meta.title: Best-1 8oz. Hummingbird Feeder
product_meta.description: This best1 8 oz hummingbird feeder has a very durable glass reservoir, a wrap around perch ring, & eight feeding ports. Base disassembles for easy clean-up.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,202 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
